dcterms:creator: Z. Chen
H. Zhang
X. Zhang
L. Zhao
dcterms:description: QQP is a binary classification task including 400,000 question pairs, where we need to value if two questions in each pair are equal or not.
dcterms:title: QQP (Quora Question Pairs)

dcterms:creator: W. B. Dolan
C. Brockett
dcterms:description: MRPC contains sentence pairs which are extracted from online news sources, in which there are annotations for whether the sentences are equal in semantic from human.
dcterms:title: MRPC (Microsoft Research Paraphrase Corpus)

dcterms:creator: R. Socher
A. Perelygin
J. Wu
J. Chuang
C. D. Manning
A. Ng
C. Potts
dcterms:description: SST-5 is a binary single-sentence classification task from the Stanford Sentiment Tree bank, including five levels of comment (from very negative to very positive), used to describe a sentence out of a movie review.
dcterms:title: SST-5 (Stanford Sentiment Treebank)

dcterms:creator: P. Rajpurkar
J. Zhang
K. Lopyrev
P. Liang
dcterms:description: SQuAD consists of questions raised by a crowd of workers on a set of Wikipedia articles, each of which is a piece of text or span from the corresponding reading paragraph. Each pair contains a question and a passage where we can find the answer.
dcterms:title: SQuAD (Stanford Question Answering Dataset v1.1)

dcterms:creator: E. F. Sang
F. De Meulder
dcterms:description: NER includes 1,393 English and 909 German news articles. To build the English-language corpus we need the RCV1 Reuters corpus where entities are annotated with LOC (location), ORG (organisation), PER (person) and MISC (miscellaneous).
dcterms:title: NER (Named Entity Recognition)

dcterms:creator: S. R. Bowman
G. Angeli
C. Potts
C. D. Manning
dcterms:description: SNLI takes a pair of sentences and predicts if the former one entails, contradicts, or is neutral with respect to the latter.
dcterms:title: SNLI (Stanford Natural Language Inference)
